checkersMain
Class CheckersGameManager

java.lang.Object
  checkersMain.CheckersGameManager

public final class CheckersGameManager
extends java.lang.Object

A Checkers game simulator that manages a game of checkers between two CheckersPlayerInterfaces. It uses multi-threading and supports pauseing. It also can add and remove CheckersGameListener, which it will notify of appropriate events. It allows the user to change several variables:

  • player1
  • player2
  • maxMoves
  • plyTime
  • waitTime

Definitions:
Ply: A player's turn/move.
Move: A round of plies; all players' plies.

Version:
1.24 - 6 November 2009
Author:
Jeremy Hoffman (v1.00), Amos Yuen

getGameOutcome

public int getGameOutcome()
Returns the game outcome.

Returns:

newGame

public void newGame()
Starts a new Checkers game on a new thread. If there is a game in progress, it will be interrupted first.

setPaused

public void setPaused(boolean paused)
Sets whether this CheckersGameManager is paused.

Parameters:
paused - - If true, pauses the current Checkers game if any. If false, unpauses the current Checkers game if any.
